name: Amitriptyline + Chlordiazepoxide (Limbitrol)
summary: A combination of a tricyclic antidepressant and a benzodiazepine, used for depression with significant anxiety.
description: Limbitrol combines amitriptyline, a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) that inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine, with chlordiazepoxide, a benzodiazepine that enhances GABAergic neurotransmission. This combination is intended for patients with depressive disorders accompanied by marked anxiety. It is less commonly prescribed today due to safety concerns related to benzodiazepines and the side effect profile of TCAs.

sections.text: Amitriptyline inhibits serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake, enhancing monoaminergic transmission. Chlordiazepoxide binds to benzodiazepine sites on the GABA-A receptor, increasing chloride influx and producing anxiolytic and sedative effects.

adult.start: 1–2 tablets/day (each containing amitriptyline 12.5–25 mg and chlordiazepoxide 5–10 mg)

sections.geriatric: Start at the lowest dose; increased risk of sedation and falls
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; avoid in severe impairment
sections.renal_impairment: No adjustment in mild/moderate; caution in severe impairment

sections.text: Anxiolytic effects within hours to days; antidepressant effects may require 2–4 weeks.

serious: respiratory depression (overdose or combination with CNS depressants)

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: TCAs may cause cardiac conduction abnormalities

items: ECG in patients with cardiac risk
Signs of benzodiazepine misuse or dependence

sections.pregnancy: Generally avoid; benzodiazepines may cause neonatal withdrawal and TCAs may have teratogenic potential.
sections.lactation: Not recommended; both drugs pass into breast milk.
sections.geriatrics: High risk of sedation, falls, and anticholinergic effects.

sections.text: Gradually taper over weeks to reduce withdrawal risk from both the benzodiazepine and the TCA.

items: Combination intended for comorbid depression and anxiety when monotherapy is insufficient.
Due to safety concerns, often replaced by SSRIs/SNRIs with separate anxiolytics if needed.
